LanguageData.PsychiteAddiction.label: cocaine addiction
LanguageData.PsychiteAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to cocaine. Long-term presence of cocaine has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of cocaine from drugs like pekoe or crack, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.YayoHigh.label: high on cocaine
LanguageData.YayoHigh.description: Pure cocaine in the bloodstream. Generates an intense euphoric high.
LanguageData.PsychiteTolerance.label: cocaine tolerance
LanguageData.PsychiteTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to cocaine. The more severe this tolerance is, the more coca-based drugs like cocaine, crack, or pekoe it takes to get the same effect.
